summary:
I am a positive and ambitious person, always willing to expand my knowledge and skills. In these 10 years of job experiences in different companies, I have demonstrated strong interpersonal skills and adaptability to different cultural and business environments. Furthermore, I have strong commitment to projects and enjoy working as a team member as well as independently. I feel comfortable taking responsibilities and working on my own initiative using strong time-management and organizational skills.

My Bachelor studies provided me with a thorough knowledge of different economic areas. Whereas my working experience gave me the opportunity to convert my theoretical background into practical skills. My record of academic achievements and professional career history demonstrate qualities that make me a valuable employee who seeks to face new challenges for a continuous development of my knowledge and qualifications in accounting and finance.

Optimism is a happiness magnet, if you stay positive: good things and good people will be drawn you!

Skill: 
▪Detail-Oriented
▪Dedication for Success

profile_positions.description:
Acting Manager

The key functions of this role :

1. Lead EMEA payroll operations to provide accurate and efficient payroll services to our EMEA employees. 
2. Supports integrations between these applications and make recommendations for improvements to provide an efficient and fully automated experience where possible. 
3. Identify business process changes that increase efficiency and improve user acceptance and overall experience. 
4. Support the end user to create an exceptional employee experience through application support, training, and standard work documentation. 
4. Partnering closely with various stakeholders (finance, tax, executive comp, HR, legal, IT, the business) to ensure payroll is processed securely as per defined procedures,
5. Adhere to legal requirements and in compliance with local laws and regulations. 
6. Manage vendor relationships for managed services supporting ADP Celergo, and ADP eTime. 
7. Ensure accuracy of financial information; compliance with Company policies and procedures including SOX and other internal control requirements
8. Support payroll activities to stabilize payroll systems and harmonize payroll processes and enhance automation. 
9. Facilitate with ADP to ensure OpCo is supported efficiently, effectively, and timely by the ADP Managed Services teams. 
10. Manage escalations of key payroll inquiries. 
11. Keep up to date on required regulatory/compliance requirements and ensure compliance across the function including working closely with the tax team. 
12. Manage operational aspects of the payroll function.
13. Ensure accurate and timely processing of various EMEA payroll data in accordance with prescribed timetables, via external service providers. 
14.  Processing inhouse the NL payroll via ADP Perman 
 15. Address payroll inquiries from employees in a timely manner. 
 16. Prepare materials for external or internal auditing and provide additional explanations when required.
profile_positions.title: Global Payroll Lead

profile_positions.description:
The key functions of this role :
▪ Responsible for the financial reporting of several legal entities that fall within the Dolby EMEA finance shared service organization based in Amsterdam such as Poland, Germany, UK and Middle East.
▪ Preparing and post journal entries in SAP for these entities as well as monitor postings done by other accounting functions.
▪ Responsible for Month-end close, Quarterly and Year-end-Close activities.
• Responsible for preparation of monthly variance analysis including correlation to operational results.
• Responsible for preparation of EMEA quarterly reporting duties.
• Managing fixed assets master data, new assets creation, disposals, depreciation, reconciliation of fixed assets to the general ledger, etc.
• Monitoring & reviewing transactions executed by the shared service team in San Francisco US.
▪ Responsible for proper & timely reconciliation of the balance sheet accounts..
▪ Responsible for VAT accounts reconciliation and Prepare and file quarterly VAT returns.
▪ Responsible for Corporate Income Tax (CIT) and deferred tax accounts reconciliation.
• Timely delivering the relevant information for the annual CIT return to the tax compliance manager.
▪ Engaging with auditors on statutory audits for assigned entities and audit deliverables.
• Preparing annual Financial Statements.
• Reviewing financial statements and variance analysis.
• Preparation of audit, analysis, annual financial statements, and related statutory reports for both US GAAP and local statutory requirements.
• Arranging / establishing meetings together with the External Auditors.
• Preparing / reviewing minutes of meetings.
▪ Translating US GAAP to Local GAAP accounting records.
▪ Coordinating with other accounting, finance and other areas to analyze questions and determine resolutions and provides accounting guidance and assistance as needed (ad-doc requests and/or projects).
• Responsible for transitioning Finance activities from Amsterdam to Dublin.
profile_positions.title: EMEA Senior GL Account

profile_positions.title: EMEA GL Accountant

profile_positions.description:
•	The key functions of this role:

• Ensuring timely and accurate preparation, reviewing, analysis, and processing of end-to-end payroll for The Netherlands, Netherlands, Turkey, Dubai, UK, Poland, Russia, Germany, Sweden and France while maintaining strict confidentiality of data.
• Handling confidential and sensitive information as well as processing data before it is sent to outsourcing company.
• Check output from 3rd party payroll provider to the submission inputs from HR.
• Supervise and maintain payroll control processes to ensure consistent and robust compliance with all legal, employment, tax, and HR labor requirements.
• Continuously identifying and executing payroll process improvements.
• Prepare payment files and responsible for the timely execution of the payroll to employees.
• Prepare monthly payroll reconciliations which include gross to net calculations.
• Ensuring that the correct GL account mapping is provided to the Payroll controllers.
• Preparing P&L and BS reconciliations appropriately and follow-up on closing the open balances with the various relevant stakeholders.
• Prepare monthly payroll journals and post in SAP.
• Review payroll associated costs i.e. vacation, pension.
• Prepare monthly accruals for leaves, overtime, vacation pay, 13/14th month pay, etc. based on the trend analysis for the previous periods.
• Responsible for Balance sheet and P&L reconciliations and investigate discrepancies.
• Monthly reconciliation & Quarterly accruals, yearly external Financial Statutory audits.
• Attend to payroll specific queries from employees.
• Working under high pressure and very tight deadlines.
• Providing monthly compensation & benefits reports to HR.
• Ensuring compliance with statutory regulations.
• Co-ordinate team members to ensure that all aspects of work are completed in a time sensitive manner.
• Responsible for establishing very good relationships with all our payroll providers and ensure proper coordination of taxes and benefits.
profile_positions.title: EMEA Payroll Accountant

profile_positions.description:
Duties & Responsibilities: 
• Work closely with the Finance Manager and create finance department in Netherlands.
• One week Finance training in Paris and two weeks SAP (ERP) training.
• SAP key user, master data handling, daily transactions and financial administration 
• Credit control management (back up) and requesting D&B report to analyze financial risk of the customer, give financial risk advice.
• Working with payroll agencies in various countries to prepare payroll, data preparation and monitoring for following cases – employees in France, Germany, Italy, Spain and UK.
• Orderly accounting filing system.
• Travel expense reports and payment order. 
• Assist in the production of financial statements, preparation of Excel, reports and
• Correspondence as required, assist with end of year preparation and procedures. 
• Plan, organize and manage own workload to ensure your contribution to the company’s
• Monthly  financial reporting process is achieved in a timely and accurate manner. 
• Support finance related queries. 
• KPMG audit & VAT meeting. 
• CBS reporting.
• Monthly ICP reporting.
• Quarterly VAT reporting.
• Managing the account payable doing payment / Account receivable from the bank Credit Agricola, Banco Popular, BTMU, Rabobank, SMBC Brussel.
• Reconciliations and making accruals.
• Balance statements.
• Provide financial support to the Jr. Finance assistant and give training (credit control).
• Create work descriptions.
• Sales report by: product, factory, customer or sales and flash report.
• Sales statistics.
• Making intercompany statements. 
• Release new product in SAP.
• Back up in absence of Finance manager.
• Other duties that may be deemed appropriate to this role
profile_positions.title: Assistant Finance Manager

profile_positions.description:
Duties & Responsibilities: 

▪ Financial supervisory, reporting and internal auditing.
▪ Responsible for the maintenance and preparation of payrolls and meet the deadlines (according to Albanian and Italian Legislation).
▪ Prepare monthly payroll reconciliations.
▪ Preparation of Balance Sheets and Financial statements.
▪ Preparation of Midterm Budget Plans and Cash Flow Forecasts.
▪ Keeping daily records for any transaction.
▪ Settlement of liabilities toward third parties.
▪ Responsible for all financial activities and transactions (recording expenses and process expense reports in weekly basis).
▪ Responsible for every month, trimester and six-months and yearly end closing.
▪ Resolve any invoice discrepancies and issues.
▪ Maintain careful  bookkeeping.
▪ Financial monthly reporting for the Albanian & Italian governments.
▪ Financial reporting for Italian embassy and Albanian Ministry of Education.
▪ Financial reporting to the Ministry of Finance.
▪ Assist with the audit for Italian Government. (Deloitte).
▪ Prepare /revise annual statutory financial statements and filing reports.
▪ Support on Albanian/ Italian tax compliance.
▪ Recording of all transactions onto the Financa5 accounting system.
▪ Preparation of payments to suppliers.
▪ Management of cash balances to ensure the office is adequately funded.
▪ Management of bank relationship and compliance with bank requirements.
▪ Compliance certificates.
▪ Debt repayments.
▪ Bank account management and reconciliation.
▪ Being initial point of contact for any administrative requests and resolutions from subsidiary entities in the group.
▪ Management of expatriate payroll to include preparation of payments for approval, production of pay slips and recharging costs to the correct entities.
Preparation of income tax returns.
▪ VAT reporting.
▪ Together with HR, ensure the correct implementation of salary administration.
▪ Project & Procurement Manager.
▪ Ad hoc assistance with any corporate restructuring.
profile_positions.title: Head of Finance & Administration Department - Finance Manager
